Questions.Question: Who is the protagonist in 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
Questions.Explanation: Scout, whose real name is Jean Louise Finch, is the main character and narrator of the novel.

Questions.Question: Which character is the antagonist in 'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone'?
Questions.Explanation: Voldemort, also known as Lord Voldemort, is the main antagonist in the Harry Potter series.

Questions.Question: Who is the love interest of Elizabeth Bennet in 'Pride and Prejudice'?
Questions.Explanation: Mr. Darcy, a wealthy and proud gentleman, becomes the love interest of Elizabeth Bennet.

Questions.Question: Which character is the narrator in 'The Great Gatsby'?
Questions.Explanation: Nick Carraway, a young bond salesman, narrates the story of Jay Gatsby and his extravagant lifestyle.

Questions.Question: Who is the main character in 'Moby-Dick'?
Questions.Explanation: Captain Ahab, a vengeful whaling captain, is the central character in the novel.

Questions.Question: Which character is the villain in 'Macbeth'?
Questions.Explanation: Macbeth, a Scottish general, becomes a tyrannical ruler and the main antagonist of the play.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'Pride and Prejudice'?
Questions.Explanation: Jane Austen, an English novelist, wrote 'Pride and Prejudice' in the early 19th century.

Questions.Question: Which character is the sidekick of Sherlock Holmes?
Questions.Explanation: Dr. Watson, a loyal and trustworthy friend, assists Sherlock Holmes in solving mysteries.

Questions.Question: Who is the main character in 'The Catcher in the Rye'?
Questions.Explanation: Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager, narrates his experiences and thoughts in the novel.

Questions.Question: Which character is the protagonist in 'The Lord of the Rings'?
Questions.Explanation: Frodo Baggins, a hobbit from the Shire, is chosen to carry the One Ring and destroy it.

Questions.Question: Who is the main character in '1984'?
Questions.Explanation: Winston Smith, a low-ranking member of the ruling Party, rebels against the oppressive regime.

Questions.Question: Which character is the protagonist in 'The Hunger Games'?
Questions.Explanation: Katniss Everdeen, a skilled archer, becomes the symbol of rebellion against the Capitol.

Questions.Question: Who is the main character in 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn'?
Questions.Explanation: Huckleberry Finn, a young boy, embarks on a journey down the Mississippi River with Jim, a runaway slave.

Questions.Question: Which character is the protagonist in 'The Chronicles of Narnia'?
Questions.Explanation: Aslan, a wise and powerful lion, is the central character in 'The Chronicles of Narnia' series.

Questions.Question: Who is the main character in 'The Picture of Dorian Gray'?
Questions.Explanation: Dorian Gray, a young man, remains eternally youthful while a portrait of him ages and reflects his sins.

Questions.Question: Which character is the protagonist in 'The Hobbit'?
Questions.Explanation: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, is recruited by Gandalf to join a quest to reclaim the Lonely Mountain.

Questions.Question: Who is the main character in 'Jane Eyre'?
Questions.Explanation: Jane Eyre, an orphaned governess, overcomes adversity and finds love and independence.

Questions.Question: Which character is the protagonist in 'The Odyssey'?
Questions.Explanation: Odysseus, a Greek hero, embarks on a long journey home after the Trojan War.

Questions.Question: Who is the main character in 'The Scarlet Letter'?
Questions.Explanation: Hester Prynne, a woman branded with a scarlet letter for adultery, faces societal judgment and redemption.

Questions.Question: Which character is the protagonist in 'The Alchemist'?
Questions.Explanation: Santiago, a young shepherd, embarks on a journey to discover his personal legend and fulfill his dreams.

Questions.Question: Who is the main character in 'The Grapes of Wrath'?
Questions.Explanation: Tom Joad, a recently released inmate, joins his family in their struggle during the Great Depression.
